paper_not_completed.warning: No matching paper found in the papers table!

paper_in_progress.detail:
We see that you have already started annotating {paper_title}. You have identified {protocols} protocols and {solutions} solutions in it, and you have already annotated in detail {annotated} of these solutions.

To continue annotating this paper, press "Continue annotation" below.

Even though we do not encourage it, if you have really changed your mind about the paper you chose to annotate, then press "Start new annotation". Please note, we only allow each annotator a maximum of two "abandoned" papers. The "Start new annotation" button will be disabled once you reach this limit.

You have abandoned {num_abandoned} paper(s).
You currently have {remaining_restarts} re-start(s) remaining.

2_pick_paper.title: Select the paper you will annotate
2_pick_paper.detail: Go through the list of five options we offer below and select the paper you are most comfortable with. If you don't like any of the five papers, click the "Refresh paper list" button for a new set.

4_question_cascade.title: Question Cascade
4_question_cascade.description: Use the link to the full-text paper to scan through it and then answer the quick questionnaire below. In this stage, you can go back through the "Pick another" button and change the paper as many times as you want. You will be allowed to abandon a "Confirmed Paper" later only twice. If you are happy with your selection, press "Confirm" to proceed to annotating your current selection.
4_question_cascade.doi_warning: DOI link not available for this paper.

questions.label: 1. Is the paper describing wet lab experiments that aim to understand protein interactions?
1a. What is the main method the authors use to understand protein interactions?
1b. Is this method preserving protein interactions in a cell-free system (e.g., whole cell extracts)?
1c. Is this method using any type of cross-linking to preserve protein interactions?
2. What is your level of familiarity with the topic of this paper?
3. What is your level of familiarity with the methods and experiments in this paper?

coffee_break_a.title: Coffee break : Confirm your selections
coffee_break_a.body: In the previous steps you identified all PI and non-PI experiments and the solutions used in the paper. Take a moment to review your selections below before you move on to the last two steps: collect details on the identified PI experiments and PI solution composition. You also have the ability to add alternative names typically used for these experiments and solutions in the scientific literature.

coffee_break_b.title: Coffee break : Confirm your selections
coffee_break_b.body: In the previous steps you identified all PI and non-PI experiments and the solutions used in the paper. Take a moment to review your selections below before you move on to the last step: collect details on the identified PI experiments and PI solution composition. You also have the ability to add alternative names typically used for these experiments and solutions in the scientific literature.

coffee_break_c.title: Coffee break : Confirm your selections
coffee_break_c.body: For each of the PI solutions that you identified in the second step, find their detailed composition in the text after selecting the right button for the type of chemical. If the composition of a solution used in the experiments is not described in detail but instead is offered as a reference to previous work, then select that reference (tab "References") with the corresponding button pressed.
